Then, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch should have a single face (face\\_1). The face contains one loop (loop\\_1) which in turn consists of 4 linear curves (line\\_1 to line\\_4). Here are the details of each curve: - line\\_1: Start point (0.0, 0.0), End point (0.075, 0.0) - line\\_2: Start point (0.075, 0.0), End point (0.075, 0.75) - line\\_3: Start point (0.075, 0.75), End point (0.0, 0.75) - line\\_4: Start point (0.0, 0.75), End point (0.0, 0.0) **Step 2: Scale the Sketch** Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch\\_scale parameter. **Step 3: Transform the Sketch into a 3D Sketch** Translate and rotate the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the translation vector and euler angles from the coordinate system. In this case, the euler angles are all zero (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and the translation vector is also zero (0.0, 0.0, 0.0). **Step 4: Extrude the Sketch to Create the 3D Model** Extrude the 2D sketch along its normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.075 towards the normal and 0.0 opposite the normal. This will create a 3D model of a long, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length of this part is 0.75 units, the width is 0.75 units, and the height is 0.075 units.</description>
